text: Jos van Nieuwstadt (born 19 November 1979) is a Dutch former footballer. He last played as a centre back for VV Capelle in the Dutch Topklasse. ==Career== Previously he played for SC Cambuur after his contract with Doncaster Rovers was terminated by mutual consent on 31 August 2009.http://www.doncasterroversfc.co.uk/page/News/0,,10329~1783425,00.html At Doncaster he scored once against Reading in 16 league appearances. Despite putting in a number of solid displays for Doncaster, he struggled to hold down a regular starting place with the Yorkshire side. Aside from Doncaster Rovers his other former clubs include Willem II and Excelsior. He also played for HSV Hoek in 2010.Ook Van Nieuwstadt naar Topklasser Hoek He has also been capped one time in the UEFA Champions League group stage. On 26 October 1999 against Spartak Moscow, Van Nieuwstadt made his Champions League debut with Willem II. ==References== ==External links== *Jos van Nieuwstadt player profile at doncasterroversfc.co.uk * Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:People from Waalwijk Category:Dutch footballers Category:Dutch expatriate footballers Category:Willem II (football club) players Category:SBV Excelsior players Category:HSV Hoek players Category:Doncaster Rovers F.C. players Category:Eredivisie players Category:Eerste Divisie players Category:Derde Divisie players Category:English Football League players Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:Association football defenders Category:FC Lienden players Category:VV Capelle players
title: Jos van Nieuwstadt
